alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 6:15PM MST until September 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING ALONG HIGHWAY 87 SOUTHWEST OF WINSLOW... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Arizona, including the following counties, east central Coconino, west central Navajo. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 612 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chevelon Canyon, Clear Creek, Jacks Canyon and Sand Draw. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Sunset Mesa, Sunset Pass, Jacks Canyon and West Sunset Mesa. - This includes the following highways... State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 34. State Route 87 between mile markers 320 and 335. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
